Text: O LORD, do not rebuke me in Your anger; do not discipline me in Your wrath.
Context: David is pleading with God to not correct him while God is angry, as it may be too harsh.

Text: Be merciful to me, O LORD, for I am faint; heal me, O LORD, for my bones are in agony.
Context: David acknowledges his weakness and asks for God's mercy, implying his condition is not just spiritual but also physical.

Text: My soul is deeply troubled. How long, O LORD, how long?
Context: David is experiencing deep emotional turmoil and seeks to know how long it will last, indicating a sense of urgency.

Text: Turn, O LORD, and deliver me; save me because of Your loving devotion.
Context: David is pleading for deliverance, relying on God's steadfast love and mercy.

Text: I am worn out from groaning; all night I flood my bed with weeping and drench my couch with tears.
Context: David expresses the extent of his sorrow, showing that his grief is continual and overwhelming.

Text: My eyes fail from grief; they grow dim because of all my foes.
Context: David speaks of his physical exhaustion from grief, which is compounded by the presence of enemies.

Text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the LORD has heard my weeping.
Context: David warns his adversaries, showing confidence that God has heard his cries.

Text: The LORD has heard my cry for mercy; the LORD accepts my prayer.
Context: David affirms that God has listened and accepted his cries for help, signaling a turning point in the psalm.

Text: All my enemies will be ashamed and dismayed; they will turn back in sudden disgrace.
